byline.original: By NILY ROZIC and LORENA GONZALEZ

abstract: Op-Ed article by New York State Assemblywoman Nily Rozic and California State Assemblywoman Lorena Gonzalez calls attention to plight of pro football cheerleaders, many of whom are paid below minimum wage and lack basic protections; notes they have both introduced legislation in their respective states to address issue, but calls on NFL to establish fair policies and protections.
lead_paragraph: Cheerleaders, the most high-profile women working in the N.F.L., are paid next to nothing and don’t receive even basic employment protection.

headline.main: Cheerleaders, Until They See Their N.F.L. Paychecks
headline.print_headline: Give Me a ‘W,’ an ‘A,’ a ‘G,’ an ‘E’

snippet: Cheerleaders, the most high-profile women working in the N.F.L., are paid next to nothing and don’t receive even basic employment protection.
